nodes.bodyText: Please add a link to here from the top-level README.
Confirmed the schema is  valid and a JSON  entry from the DB matches it using https://www.jsonschemavalidator.net/. Good stuff.
please give an example or two of a search parameter.
is there a fixed list (enum) of valid types, or is this free-form?
CriteriaType enum is used to populate this property.

I don't understand how parent vs child maps to group vs no group. Is this really more of an enum  instead of a boolean?
I'm guessing group = true indicates this is a parent property.
A parent subsumes children and a child subsumes nothing
Can you please indicate what source and standard mean here? Not all analysts will be familiar with the tools.
Please indicate the scope/uniqueness of this  ID, e.g. "uniquely identifies a concept  in the CDR being  searched to produce  this  cohort."
So this is a non-required  property, and will be absent if not applicable?

Turns out this is deprecated and no longer used in the codebase, but we still have json cohort definitions that include it. So added deprecation to description and created a ticket to remove this property from the SearchParameter: https://precisionmedicineinitiative.atlassian.net/browse/RW-5680
